educations.schoolName: Michigan State University College of Law

headline: Law Clerk at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
Passion. Loyalty. Excellence. These are the words I use to describe my professional attitude. My drive to be the best that I can be is one that is only rivaled by my perfectionist mentality. 

We are all looking for something in life. For some this may be wealth. For others it might be happiness. For me, I am looking for the next challenge. I am always looking for ways to challenge myself in order to become the absolute best that I can be. This is why I have decided to take on the endeavor of attending the Michigan State University College of Law.

positions.description: Interviewed and gathered data on clients who have been affected by the Flint Water Crisis and helped further the class action lawsuit against multiple governmental entities.
positions.title: Flint Water Class Action Legal Team

positions.description: My duties included laboring for major construction projects on site. The skills needed to accomplish my tasks include determination, hard work, and attention to detail.
positions.title: Maintenance Laborer

positions.description:
I provided tutoring and guidance to students in the Criminal Justice field of study, Homeland Security Specialization, and Legal Studies minor. Examples of classes I have tutored for include but are not limited to Introduction to the Law and Legal System, Substantive Criminal Law, Business Law, and Legal Issues of Counter Terrorism. 
I have also conducted Legal Case Brief Workshops at the request of the faculty where I give a lesson on how to properly research legal material (on an undergraduate level) and how to present it in a legal brief as per class standards.
I have been highly successful as a tutor, with my student's grades increasing and high satisfactory marks from those I have tutored.
positions.location: Saint Leo University, Learning Resource Center
positions.title: Criminal Justice Student Tutor

positions.description:
My duties included providing mentorship and guidance to the incoming class on how to adjust to college life. I spent the two weeks before school began to be with the incoming class in order to get to know them and attempted to sort out any and all issues that may have come up. 
I also was an assistant for the PAL Labs. These labs were a freshman experience class where students were given assignments to describe their experience to the present time and where they would mention any issues they were facing. It was my job to make sure the issues were taken care of.
The outcome of this program was highly successful. I had students who wanted to transfer or drop out stay because they felt that I was the mentor that they needed to make it through their first year of college.
positions.location: Saint Leo University, Office of First Year Experience
positions.title: Program for the Advancement of Learning Mentor
